tn.text: This is the beginning of the list of Adam's descendants.

This phrase means that God made mankind to be like him. This verse does not tell in what ways God made people to be like himself. God does not have a body, so it does not mean that people would look like God. AT: "to truly be like us." See how "after our likeness" is translated in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:26|1:26]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
This can be made active. AT: "when he created them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

Translators may write the numerals "130" and "800" or the words "one hundred thirty" and "eight hundred." (The ULB and the UDB use numerals if the number has three or more words; they use words if a number has only one or two words.) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: he became the father of a son
tn.text: "he had a son"

tn.ref: in his own likeness, after his image
tn.text: These two phrases mean the same thing. They are used as a reminder that God made man in his own image. See how you translated similar phrases in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:01:26|1:26]].
Translate this name as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:04:25|4:25]].

tn.ref: He became the father of more sons and daughters
tn.text: "He had more sons and daughters"
This phrase will be repeated throughout the chapter. Use the ordinary word for "died."
People used to live a very long time. Use your ordinary word for "years." AT: "Adam lived a total of 930 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: he became the father of Enosh
tn.text: Here "father" means his actual father, not his grandfather. AT: "he had his son Enosh."
This is the name of a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: and became the father of more sons and daughters
tn.text: "and had more sons and daughters"
"Seth lived a total of 912 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This phrase is repeated throughout the chapter. Use the ordinary word for "died."

The records in Genesis 5:6-27 have the same format. Translate them according to the notes in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:05:06|5:6-8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

The records in Genesis 5:6-27 have the same format. Translate them according to the notes in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:05:06|5:6-8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: he became the father of Methuselah
tn.text: "he had his son Methuselah"
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

To walk with someone is a metaphor for being in a close relationship with him. AT: "Enoch had a close relationship with God" or "Enoch lived in union with God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: He became the father of more sons and daughters
tn.text: "He had more sons and daughters"
"Enoch lived a total of 365 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The word "he" refers to Enoch. He was no longer on earth.
This means that God took Enoch to be with himself (God).

The records in Genesis 5:6-27 have the same format. Translate them according to the notes in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:05:06|5:6-8]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This Lamech is different from the Lamech in [[:en:bible:notes:gen:04:18|4:18]].

tn.ref: became the father of a son
tn.text: "had a son"
Translators may want to add a footnote that says: "This name sounds like the Hebrew word that means 'rest.'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]).

tn.ref: from our work and from the painful labor of our hands
tn.text: Lamech says the same thing twice to emphasize how hard the work was. AT: "from working so hard with our hands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Lamech lived a total of 777 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"he had his sons." This does not tell us whether the sons were born on the same day or in different years.

These sons may not be listed in the order of their birth. There is disagreement about which one was the oldest. Avoid translating this in a way that implies that the list is in the order of their ages.
